title: Jurassic Park
author: Michael Crichton
plot: A breakthrough in genetic engineering leads to the development of a technique for recovering and cloning dinosaur DNA, a method that brings about the creation of Jurassic Park, a tourist attraction populated by creatures extinct for eons.

title: Blindsight
author: Peter Watts
plot: A very small crew of variously augmented humans (and one vampire) are sent to investigate and possibly initiate first contact after Earth is conspicuously noticed.

title: Rum Punch
author: Elmore Leonard
plot: Ordell “Whitebread” Robbie makes a fine living selling illegal high-powered weaponry to the wrong people. Jackie Burke couriers Ordell’s profits from Freeport to Miami. But the feds are on to Jackie—and now the aging but still hot flight attendant will have to do prison time or play ball, which makes her a prime “loose end” that Ordell needs to tie up permanently. Jackie, however, has other options. And with the help of Max Cherry—an honest but disgruntled bail bondsman looking to get out—she could even end up with a serious nest egg in the process.

title: Lonesome Dove
author: Larry McMurtry
plot: Two former Texas Rangers embark on an epic cattle drive from Texas to Montana.

title: Blood Meridian
author: Cormac McCarthy
plot: A young man journeys through the violent landscape of the American West with a dangerous gang of scalp hunters.

title: Get Shorty
author: Elmore Leonard
plot: A Miami mobster goes to Hollywood to collect a debt and finds himself drawn into the movie business.

author: Stephen King
plot: A high school English teacher travels back in time to try and prevent the assassination of John F. Kennedy.

title: No Country For Old Men
author: Cormac McCarthy
plot: A hunter finds a fortune in cash and becomes the target of a relentless and enigmatic killer.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
plot: Thrown in prison for a crime he has not committed, Edmond Dantès is confined to the grim fortress of If. There he learns of a great hoard of treasure hidden on the Isle of Monte Cristo and he becomes determined not only to escape, but also to use the treasure to plot the destruction of the three men responsible for his incarceration. Dumas’ epic tale of suffering and retribution, inspired by a real-life case of wrongful imprisonment, was a huge popular success when it was first serialized in the 1840s.

title: All The Pretty Horses
author: Cormac McCarthy
plot: Teenager John Grady Cole, the last of a long line of Texas ranchers, has nothing left to stay for. Across the border Mexico beckons—beautiful and desolate, rugged and cruelly civilized. With neighbor Rawlins, and scruffy boy, he rides toward an idyllic, sometimes comic adventure, to a place where dreams are paid for in blood.
